title: Westfalenstadion - Wikipedia
snippet: After Borussia Dortmund won the ... main grandstands, the eastern and the western blocks, received a second tier. Covered by a new roof-construction, each section housed an additional 6,000 seats....

title: Signal Iduna Park – Wikipedia
snippet: Der Signal Iduna Park (Eigenschreibweise: SIGNAL IDUNA PARK; bei UEFA-Wettbewerben werbefrei BVB Stadion Dortmund), bis Dezember 2005 und im Sprachgebrauch auch Westfalenstadion, ist ein Fußballstadion im Bezirk Innenstadt-West der nordrhein-westfälischen Großstadt Dortmund.

title: Borussia Dortmund celebrate 50 years of the Westfalenstadion | Bundesliga
snippet: Known worldwide for its iconic Yellow Wall, Borussia Dortmund marked 50 years of the Westfalenstadion prior to their Matchday 28 meeting with VfB Stuttgart. The home of German and European champions, the 81,365-capacity arena has created more ...

title: Westfalenstadion on World Stadium Database
snippet: Westfalenstadion boasts state-of-the-art amenities, including modern hospitality suites and media facilities, making it not only a hub for football but also a versatile venue for concerts and other events.

title: Signal Iduna Park (Westfalenstadion) – StadiumDB.com
snippet: Stadium: Signal Iduna Park (Westfalenstadion), Dortmund, Germany, capacity: 81365, club: BV Borussia Dortmund.
